definition: to make the motion of seizing : clutch
to clasp or embrace especially with the fingers or arms
examples: grasped the pen and began writing

definition: to lay hold of with the mind : comprehend
examples: failed to grasp the danger of the situation

definition: to reach for or try anything in desperation

examples: kept a firm grasp on the rope
The books on the top shelf were beyond my grasp.

definition: the power of seizing and holding or attaining
mental hold or comprehension especially when broad
examples: a remarkable grasp of the subject
